name: p-nitrobenzamide
source: Beilstein F. K.; Beilsteins Handbuch der Organischen Chemie. Springer; Berlin; 1972.
Reason: ##The basic unit for this compound is benzamide, which has a melting point of 128°C. The presence of the nitro group (-NO2) in the para position introduces a strong withdrawing group that increases intermolecular forces and melting point. The nitro group can be estimated to increase the melting point by approximately +50°C. The carbonyl group (-C=O) in the amide introduces polar carbonyl interactions, contributing approximately +40°C.
